notesStmt.note: Large losses to damp, mould and worms repaired/infilled before rebinding. A few very dark stains, and many of the repairs obscure text. Many leaves mutilated.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Various Naskhi styles of the 11th to 12th century. A Naskhi hand of the 11th century. Probably an autograph of ʿAli ibn Suleymān. A Naskhi hand of the 11th century. Probably the same as in Part I of the volume. Naskhi hands of the 11th to 12th century. A Naskhi script and a Hebrew Oriental semi-cursive script of the 11th to 12th century.
